title: How to Make Vegan Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Lightly grease the inside of a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with oil or cooking spray.

steps.headline: Stir together the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Put the flour, sugar, coca powder, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl. Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until everything is evenly mixed together. For a twist, try 1 cup (225 grams) of white sugar and 1 cup (200 grams) of brown sugar instead.

steps.headline: Whisk in the remaining wet ingredients.
steps.description: Make a small well in the center of the flour mixture, then pour in the water, oil, and vanilla extract. Stir everything together until you get a smooth, creamy batter. For lighter, less-riche brownies, use only ½ cup (120 milliliters) of oil. For richer brownies, use up to 1 cup (240 milliliters) of oil.

steps.headline: Consider folding in some extras, such as chopped walnuts or began chocolate chips.
steps.description: Either option will give your brownies extra flavor and texture. Use a rubber spatula to do this, and be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl so that everything mixes evenly.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into your prepared baking pan.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to help guild the batter into the pan, and to scrape any residue off the sides of the bowl. Is you need to, use the rubber spatula to help smooth the top of the batter down. This will help give your brownies a more consistent thickness.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 30 minutes.
steps.description: The brownies should be crusty and piping hot. You can check to see whether or not the brownies are done by poking a toothpick into the center. If the toothpick comes out dry and clean, they're done! If not, bake the brownies for another 5 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Let the brownies for 10 minutes to cool before slicing them into bars.
steps.description: Keep the brownies in the baking pan as you cut them, then serve them on a plate. They go great with some whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

steps.headline: Preheat you oven to 330°F (165°).
steps.description: Grease a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with cooking spray.

steps.headline: Whisk together the milk, oil, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: If you want to use flaxseed instead of cornstarch, add the flax seed in now. If you are going to use cornstarch, hold off on it for now. You can use any type of non-dairy milk, such as almond, coconut, or soy. If you are using coconut milk, be sure that you drain away the cream, or your brownies may end up too rich.

steps.headline: Combine the rest of the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Put the flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, white sugar, and brown sugar into the bowl. If you plan on using cornstarch instead of flaxseed, add it in now. Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until combined.

steps.headline: Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture, and stir it together once more.
steps.description: Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl every so often. This will ensure that everything mixes evenly, and that no streaks of flour remain.

steps.headline: Fold in chocolate chips gently if desired.
steps.description: You can use special vegan chocolate chips, o you can use baking chocolate chips, which are usually dairy-free. You can also use chopped walnuts instead.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into your prepared baking pan.
steps.description: Use your rubber spatula to help guild the batter into the pan, and the scrape any residue off the sides of the bowl. If you need to, use the rubber spatula to help smooth down the top of the brownies; this will ensure that everything bakes evenly.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 16 minutes.
steps.description: They will look a little damp and underdone, but this is fine.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the brownies for 2 to 4 hours.
steps.description: This helps firm the brownies up and make them easier to cut. Do not take the brownies out of the pan or cut them just yet, however.

steps.headline: Prepare the fudge topping.
steps.description: Melt the coconut oil in a small saucepan over low heat. Take the saucepan off the stove, and stir in the cocoa powder and maple syrup. Keep stirring until everything is smooth and well-blended. If you don't like maple syrup, or can't find it, try agave nectar instead.

steps.headline: Pour the fudge topping over the brownies, and refrigerate it for 20 more minutes.
steps.description: This will help solidify the fudge topping, and make it more fudge-y and less syrupy. For deluxe brownies, sprinkle a handful of chopped walnuts on top.

steps.headline: Cut the brownies while they are still in the pan, then serve them on a plate.
steps.description: These taste rich enough to serve on their own, buy you can also serve them with some ice cream or whipped cream.

steps.headline: Preheat you oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Grease the inside of a 9 by 9-inch (22.86 by 22.86-centimeter) square baking pan with cooking spray.

steps.headline: Stir together the oil and sugar.
steps.description: Pour the oil and the sugar into a large mixing bowl, then stir them together with a whisk until they are evenly combined. Make sure that the bowl is big enough to fit the rest of your ingredients.

steps.headline: Whisk in the unsweetened applesauce, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: The applesauce replaces some of the oil, making the brownies a little healthier. Make sure that you use the smooth kind of applesauce, and not the kind with large chunks in it.

steps.headline: Stir in the melted chocolate and salt into the batter.
steps.description: If you have not yet done so, melt the chocolate using a double-boiler or the microwave, then pour it into the batter. Add the salt, then stir everything together.

steps.headline: Add in the flour slowly, and stir it in using a whisk.
steps.description: Add the flour slowly while whisking your ingredients together with a whisk. Be sure to break up any clumps that you see.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chips gently.
steps.description: Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula while doing this. It will help make the batter more consistent.

steps.headline: Pour the battle into the prepared pan.
steps.description: Use the rubber spatula to guide the batter into the baking pan. If there is any residue on the sides of the bowl, use the rubber spatula to scrape it into the bowl so that it doesn't go to waste.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 25 to 28 minutes.
steps.description: They are ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean. Another way to test for doneness is to lightly touch the top. If it springs back, the brownies are done.

steps.headline: Let the brownies cool for at least 10 minutes before you cut them and serve them.
steps.description: Do not take the brownies out of the pan until after you have cut them. Once you have them cut, you can serve them with some ice cream or whipped cream.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Spray a standard-sized muffin tin with cooking spray; you can also line them with muffin liners instead. You will have enough batter to fill 8 wells, so if you have a large muffin tin, you don't end up using all of it. You can also make this recipe using a mini muffin tin. You will have enough batter to make about 24 mini brownies.

steps.headline: Prepare your flax egg, and let it rest for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Pour 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) of water into a small bowl. Add 2 tablespoons (15 grams) of flaxseed meal into the water. Wait 5 minutes for the flaxseed to absorb the water and thicken. These flax eggs replace the chicken eggs typically found in non-vegan brownie recipes. While the flax eggs are "resting," you can start melting the butter.

steps.headline: Melt the vegan butter, then stir in the flax eggs.
steps.description: You can melt the vegan butter in the microwave or in a small saucepan over the stove. Once the butter is melted, pour it into a large mixing bowl, then stir the flax eggs in with a whisk.

steps.headline: Add the sugar, vanilla extract, baking powder, salt, and cocoa, and stir with a whisk.
steps.description: Keep stirring until everything is evenly combined. Your batter will still look a little thin, but this is because you have not added in the flour yet.

steps.headline: Whisk in the flour slowly.
steps.description: Add the flour slowly into the batter to prevent clumping. Use a whisk to beat it into the rest of the batter well. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often to ensure that everything mixes evenly.

steps.headline: Fold in some vegan chocolate chips or chopped walnuts, if desired.
steps.description: These are not completely necessary, but they can give extra texture and flavor to your brownies. If you are baking your brownies in a mini muffin tin, consider using mini chocolate chips instead; if you want to use chopped walnuts, you may have to chop them up into smaller pieces.

steps.headline: Fill the wells in the muffin tin three-quarters of the way full.
steps.description: A good way to do this would be with a tablespoon or with an ice cream scoop. This way, you can ensure that every well gets the same amount of batter. You'll also be less likely to spill and waste batter.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 22 to 26 minutes.
steps.description: They are ready when they start to pull away from the sides of the tin. Another way to test for doneness is to touch the top; they are done if they spring back slightly. If you are baking these in a mini muffin tin, they will take about 16 minutes to bake. You might want to check from for doneness after about 10 minutes, however.

steps.headline: Let the brownies cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then take them out.
steps.description: At this point, you can serve them on a plate, or let them finish cooling the rest of the way on a wire cooling rack.

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Making Basic Vegan Brownies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Lightly grease the inside of a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with oil or cooking spray. Stir together the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Put the flour, sugar, coca powder, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl. Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until everything is evenly mixed together. For a twist, try 1 cup (225 grams) of white sugar and 1 cup (200 grams) of brown sugar instead. Whisk in the remaining wet ingredients. Make a small well in the center of the flour mixture, then pour in the water, oil, and vanilla extract. Stir everything together until you get a smooth, creamy batter. For lighter, less-riche brownies, use only ½ cup (120 milliliters) of oil. For richer brownies, use up to 1 cup (240 milliliters) of oil. Consider folding in some extras, such as chopped walnuts or began chocolate chips. Either option will give your brownies extra flavor and texture. Use a rubber spatula to do this, and be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl so that everything mixes evenly. Pour the batter into your prepared baking pan. Use a rubber spatula to help guild the batter into the pan, and to scrape any residue off the sides of the bowl. Is you need to, use the rubber spatula to help smooth the top of the batter down. This will help give your brownies a more consistent thickness. Bake the brownies for 30 minutes. The brownies should be crusty and piping hot. You can check to see whether or not the brownies are done by poking a toothpick into the center. If the toothpick comes out dry and clean, they're done! If not, bake the brownies for another 5 to 10 minutes. Let the brownies for 10 minutes to cool before slicing them into bars. Keep the brownies in the baking pan as you cut them, then serve them on a plate. They go great with some whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. Making Chocolate Fudge Vegan Brownies Preheat you oven to 330°F (165°). Grease a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with cooking spray. Whisk together the milk, oil, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl. If you want to use flaxseed instead of cornstarch, add the flax seed in now. If you are going to use cornstarch, hold off on it for now. You can use any type of non-dairy milk, such as almond, coconut, or soy. If you are using coconut milk, be sure that you drain away the cream, or your brownies may end up too rich. Combine the rest of the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Put the flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, white sugar, and brown sugar into the bowl. If you plan on using cornstarch instead of flaxseed, add it in now. Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until combined. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture, and stir it together once more. Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl every so often. This will ensure that everything mixes evenly, and that no streaks of flour remain. Fold in chocolate chips gently if desired. You can use special vegan chocolate chips, o you can use baking chocolate chips, which are usually dairy-free. You can also use chopped walnuts instead. Pour the batter into your prepared baking pan. Use your rubber spatula to help guild the batter into the pan, and the scrape any residue off the sides of the bowl. If you need to, use the rubber spatula to help smooth down the top of the brownies; this will ensure that everything bakes evenly. Bake the brownies for 16 minutes. They will look a little damp and underdone, but this is fine. Refrigerate the brownies for 2 to 4 hours. This helps firm the brownies up and make them easier to cut. Do not take the brownies out of the pan or cut them just yet, however. Prepare the fudge topping. Melt the coconut oil in a small saucepan over low heat. Take the saucepan off the stove, and stir in the cocoa powder and maple syrup. Keep stirring until everything is smooth and well-blended. If you don't like maple syrup, or can't find it, try agave nectar instead. Pour the fudge topping over the brownies, and refrigerate it for 20 more minutes. This will help solidify the fudge topping, and make it more fudge-y and less syrupy. For deluxe brownies, sprinkle a handful of chopped walnuts on top. Cut the brownies while they are still in the pan, then serve them on a plate. These taste rich enough to serve on their own, buy you can also serve them with some ice cream or whipped cream. Making Healthier Vegan Brownies Preheat you oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease the inside of a 9 by 9-inch (22.86 by 22.86-centimeter) square baking pan with cooking spray. Stir together the oil and sugar. Pour the oil and the sugar into a large mixing bowl, then stir them together with a whisk until they are evenly combined. Make sure that the bowl is big enough to fit the rest of your ingredients. Whisk in the unsweetened applesauce, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract. The applesauce replaces some of the oil, making the brownies a little healthier. Make sure that you use the smooth kind of applesauce, and not the kind with large chunks in it. Stir in the melted chocolate and salt into the batter. If you have not yet done so, melt the chocolate using a double-boiler or the microwave, then pour it into the batter. Add the salt, then stir everything together. Add in the flour slowly, and stir it in using a whisk. Add the flour slowly while whisking your ingredients together with a whisk. Be sure to break up any clumps that you see. Fold in the chocolate chips gently. Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula while doing this. It will help make the batter more consistent. Pour the battle into the prepared pan. Use the rubber spatula to guide the batter into the baking pan. If there is any residue on the sides of the bowl, use the rubber spatula to scrape it into the bowl so that it doesn't go to waste. Bake the brownies for 25 to 28 minutes. They are ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean. Another way to test for doneness is to lightly touch the top. If it springs back, the brownies are done. Let the brownies cool for at least 10 minutes before you cut them and serve them. Do not take the brownies out of the pan until after you have cut them. Once you have them cut, you can serve them with some ice cream or whipped cream. Vegan Brownie Bites Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Spray a standard-sized muffin tin with cooking spray; you can also line them with muffin liners instead. You will have enough batter to fill 8 wells, so if you have a large muffin tin, you don't end up using all of it. You can also make this recipe using a mini muffin tin. You will have enough batter to make about 24 mini brownies. Prepare your flax egg, and let it rest for 5 minutes. Pour 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) of water into a small bowl. Add 2 tablespoons (15 grams) of flaxseed meal into the water. Wait 5 minutes for the flaxseed to absorb the water and thicken. These flax eggs replace the chicken eggs typically found in non-vegan brownie recipes. While the flax eggs are "resting," you can start melting the butter. Melt the vegan butter, then stir in the flax eggs. You can melt the vegan butter in the microwave or in a small saucepan over the stove. Once the butter is melted, pour it into a large mixing bowl, then stir the flax eggs in with a whisk. Add the sugar, vanilla extract, baking powder, salt, and cocoa, and stir with a whisk. Keep stirring until everything is evenly combined. Your batter will still look a little thin, but this is because you have not added in the flour yet. Whisk in the flour slowly. Add the flour slowly into the batter to prevent clumping. Use a whisk to beat it into the rest of the batter well. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often to ensure that everything mixes evenly. Fold in some vegan chocolate chips or chopped walnuts, if desired. These are not completely necessary, but they can give extra texture and flavor to your brownies. If you are baking your brownies in a mini muffin tin, consider using mini chocolate chips instead; if you want to use chopped walnuts, you may have to chop them up into smaller pieces. Fill the wells in the muffin tin three-quarters of the way full. A good way to do this would be with a tablespoon or with an ice cream scoop. This way, you can ensure that every well gets the same amount of batter. You'll also be less likely to spill and waste batter. Bake the brownies for 22 to 26 minutes. They are ready when they start to pull away from the sides of the tin. Another way to test for doneness is to touch the top; they are done if they spring back slightly. If you are baking these in a mini muffin tin, they will take about 16 minutes to bake. You might want to check from for doneness after about 10 minutes, however. Let the brownies cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then take them out. At this point, you can serve them on a plate, or let them finish cooling the rest of the way on a wire cooling rack. Finished.
sentences: Making Basic Vegan Brownies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
Lightly grease the inside of a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with oil or cooking spray.
Stir together the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
Put the flour, sugar, coca powder, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl.
Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until everything is evenly mixed together.
For a twist, try 1 cup (225 grams) of white sugar and 1 cup (200 grams) of brown sugar instead.
Whisk in the remaining wet ingredients.
Make a small well in the center of the flour mixture, then pour in the water, oil, and vanilla extract.
Stir everything together until you get a smooth, creamy batter.
For lighter, less-riche brownies, use only ½ cup (120 milliliters) of oil.
For richer brownies, use up to 1 cup (240 milliliters) of oil.
Consider folding in some extras, such as chopped walnuts or began chocolate chips.
Either option will give your brownies extra flavor and texture.
Use a rubber spatula to do this, and be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl so that everything mixes evenly.
Pour the batter into your prepared baking pan.
Use a rubber spatula to help guild the batter into the pan, and to scrape any residue off the sides of the bowl.
Is you need to, use the rubber spatula to help smooth the top of the batter down.
This will help give your brownies a more consistent thickness.
Bake the brownies for 30 minutes.
The brownies should be crusty and piping hot.
You can check to see whether or not the brownies are done by poking a toothpick into the center.
If the toothpick comes out dry and clean, they're done!
If not, bake the brownies for another 5 to 10 minutes.
Let the brownies for 10 minutes to cool before slicing them into bars.
Keep the brownies in the baking pan as you cut them, then serve them on a plate.
They go great with some whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.
Making Chocolate Fudge Vegan Brownies Preheat you oven to 330°F (165°).
Grease a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with cooking spray.
Whisk together the milk, oil, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl.
If you want to use flaxseed instead of cornstarch, add the flax seed in now.
If you are going to use cornstarch, hold off on it for now.
You can use any type of non-dairy milk, such as almond, coconut, or soy.
If you are using coconut milk, be sure that you drain away the cream, or your brownies may end up too rich.
Combine the rest of the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
Put the flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, white sugar, and brown sugar into the bowl.
If you plan on using cornstarch instead of flaxseed, add it in now.
Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until combined.
Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture, and stir it together once more.
Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl every so often.
This will ensure that everything mixes evenly, and that no streaks of flour remain.
Fold in chocolate chips gently if desired.
You can use special vegan chocolate chips, o you can use baking chocolate chips, which are usually dairy-free.
You can also use chopped walnuts instead.
Pour the batter into your prepared baking pan.
Use your rubber spatula to help guild the batter into the pan, and the scrape any residue off the sides of the bowl.
If you need to, use the rubber spatula to help smooth down the top of the brownies; this will ensure that everything bakes evenly.
Bake the brownies for 16 minutes.
They will look a little damp and underdone, but this is fine.
Refrigerate the brownies for 2 to 4 hours.
This helps firm the brownies up and make them easier to cut.
Do not take the brownies out of the pan or cut them just yet, however.
Prepare the fudge topping.
Melt the coconut oil in a small saucepan over low heat.
Take the saucepan off the stove, and stir in the cocoa powder and maple syrup.
Keep stirring until everything is smooth and well-blended.
If you don't like maple syrup, or can't find it, try agave nectar instead.
Pour the fudge topping over the brownies, and refrigerate it for 20 more minutes.
This will help solidify the fudge topping, and make it more fudge-y and less syrupy.
For deluxe brownies, sprinkle a handful of chopped walnuts on top.
Cut the brownies while they are still in the pan, then serve them on a plate.
These taste rich enough to serve on their own, buy you can also serve them with some ice cream or whipped cream.
Making Healthier Vegan Brownies Preheat you oven to 350°F (180°C).
Grease the inside of a 9 by 9-inch (22.86 by 22.86-centimeter) square baking pan with cooking spray.
Stir together the oil and sugar.
Pour the oil and the sugar into a large mixing bowl, then stir them together with a whisk until they are evenly combined.
Make sure that the bowl is big enough to fit the rest of your ingredients.
Whisk in the unsweetened applesauce, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract.
The applesauce replaces some of the oil, making the brownies a little healthier.
Make sure that you use the smooth kind of applesauce, and not the kind with large chunks in it.
Stir in the melted chocolate and salt into the batter.
If you have not yet done so, melt the chocolate using a double-boiler or the microwave, then pour it into the batter.
Add the salt, then stir everything together.
Add in the flour slowly, and stir it in using a whisk.
Add the flour slowly while whisking your ingredients together with a whisk.
Be sure to break up any clumps that you see.
Fold in the chocolate chips gently.
Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula while doing this.
It will help make the batter more consistent.
Pour the battle into the prepared pan.
Use the rubber spatula to guide the batter into the baking pan.
If there is any residue on the sides of the bowl, use the rubber spatula to scrape it into the bowl so that it doesn't go to waste.
Bake the brownies for 25 to 28 minutes.
They are ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean.
Another way to test for doneness is to lightly touch the top.
If it springs back, the brownies are done.
Let the brownies cool for at least 10 minutes before you cut them and serve them.
Do not take the brownies out of the pan until after you have cut them.
Once you have them cut, you can serve them with some ice cream or whipped cream.
Vegan Brownie Bites Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
Spray a standard-sized muffin tin with cooking spray; you can also line them with muffin liners instead.
You will have enough batter to fill 8 wells, so if you have a large muffin tin, you don't end up using all of it.
You can also make this recipe using a mini muffin tin.
You will have enough batter to make about 24 mini brownies.
Prepare your flax egg, and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Pour 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) of water into a small bowl.
Add 2 tablespoons (15 grams) of flaxseed meal into the water.
Wait 5 minutes for the flaxseed to absorb the water and thicken.
These flax eggs replace the chicken eggs typically found in non-vegan brownie recipes.
While the flax eggs are "resting," you can start melting the butter.
Melt the vegan butter, then stir in the flax eggs.
You can melt the vegan butter in the microwave or in a small saucepan over the stove.
Once the butter is melted, pour it into a large mixing bowl, then stir the flax eggs in with a whisk.
Add the sugar, vanilla extract, baking powder, salt, and cocoa, and stir with a whisk.
Keep stirring until everything is evenly combined.
Your batter will still look a little thin, but this is because you have not added in the flour yet.
Whisk in the flour slowly.
Add the flour slowly into the batter to prevent clumping.
Use a whisk to beat it into the rest of the batter well.
Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often to ensure that everything mixes evenly.
Fold in some vegan chocolate chips or chopped walnuts, if desired.
These are not completely necessary, but they can give extra texture and flavor to your brownies.
If you are baking your brownies in a mini muffin tin, consider using mini chocolate chips instead; if you want to use chopped walnuts, you may have to chop them up into smaller pieces.
Fill the wells in the muffin tin three-quarters of the way full.
A good way to do this would be with a tablespoon or with an ice cream scoop.
This way, you can ensure that every well gets the same amount of batter.
You'll also be less likely to spill and waste batter.
Bake the brownies for 22 to 26 minutes.
They are ready when they start to pull away from the sides of the tin.
Another way to test for doneness is to touch the top; they are done if they spring back slightly.
If you are baking these in a mini muffin tin, they will take about 16 minutes to bake.
You might want to check from for doneness after about 10 minutes, however.
Let the brownies cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then take them out.
At this point, you can serve them on a plate, or let them finish cooling the rest of the way on a wire cooling rack.
Finished.
